{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":2998767,"name":"TJ","username":"tjNeu","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/4491bb/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-01-27T02:08:39.819Z","cooked":"

Our team is experimenting with Aux PID to synch our motors. To first see how it works, we deployed the CTRE example to our robot to see it run:

github.com

Phoenix-Examples-Languages/Java...

master/Java%20General/MotionMagic_AuxStraightQuadrature/src/main/java/frc/robot

HERO C#, FRC C++/Java, future platforms. Contribute to CrossTheRoadElec/Phoenix-Examples-Languages development by creating an account on GitHub.

But it doesn’t work. We are using TalonSRX just like the example, set up the correct CANIDs, and we fixed the sensor phase to line up with our encoders. The arcade drive runs correctly (both motors drive in the correct direction and the encoders accumulate the same). But, when we run MotionMagic, the left side runs in reverse while the right runs in the forward direction. We even tried the Position control example and it did the same thing. We also ran the individual MotionMagic example and made sure everything was configured correctly. It did run the MotionMagic correctly when we did that. But still, the Aux examples, when called, make the sides drive opposite. So, we believe the Aux/Remote stuff is messing with the left side.

Does anyone have any idea why the example code isn’t running on our robot when everything’s (we think) set up correctly?

I don’t have any idea why it’s doing what it’s doing, but I had the exact experience when I tried it a couple years ago with the TalonSRX.

Trying it again this year with TalonFX controllers works just fine.

Did you try switching which sides you are inverting on the drivetrain?

Also, not ever having gotten it working, I don’t know how to help you fix it. However, if you take a look at the TalonFX version of the same code, they have a config function starting on line 329 that figures out whether it should be sum or difference for the auxiliary pid stuff based on the Talon configuration.

I would be willing to bet that you either need to swap your right and left sides, or do some similar math to figure out which is the correct sensor configuration for your encoder and motor controller setup.

A couple years ago @ozrien and/or possibly Jacob from CTR spent a good amount of back and forth here on Chief Delphi trying to get ours working but we never quite succeeded … and then the build season took my attention to other things so I just sort of abandoned it.

Auxiliary on-motor-controller PID is a very convoluted architecture that I would not recommend.

Consider instead a “cascading” control scheme from the RIO, or manually adding additional feedback through the arbitraryFeedforward feature.

We tested it on TalonFX and it works! It’s weird how it doesn’t work on TalonSRX, but we might do some further experimenting if time permits. Thank you!
